articleBody.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"ReportPortal has several features to support effective test failure analysis. This article provides actionable strategies for setting up Pattern Analysis rules to maximize the potential of this powerful analytical method and drive better business outcomes.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is Pattern Analysis?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Pattern Analysis is a feature used in software testing to help identify and analyze recurring patterns in error logs. It is commonly used in automation testing reporting tools, such as ReportPortal, to streamline the process of debugging and resolving test failures.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The following sections will guide you through the best practices and practical examples that demonstrate how Pattern Analysis can be implemented in various contexts.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. Create rules for standard errors","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"If you don’t know where to start with Pattern Analysis, create rules for common errors:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"400 Bad Request","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – this could indicate an issue with the tests. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"401 Unauthorized","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – something may not be properly specified in the tests. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"403 Forbidden","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – this could be a product issue, or certain details like passwords might not be provided in the tests. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"500 Internal Server Error","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – this is likely not an issue with the automated tests; it suggests that your servers or some external services are unavailable. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Create rules to search for these errors, run Pattern Analysis on a launch, and it will be easier to sort test failures by defect types.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6Wnpw84AenyTPbCV32uEES","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For example, consider the following: error codes in the 400-409 range are often caused by a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Product Bug","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" or an ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Automation Bug","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". A 500 Internal Server Error most often corresponds to a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Product Bug","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" or a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"System Issue","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". However, it's essential to review the error log to assign the correct defect type.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2. Study the documentation for your project","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ask developers about errors that can be observed in backend responses, which ones are critical, and which are less serious. Based on this information, create rules for Pattern Analysis to address these errors.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3. Create rules using regular expressions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In ReportPortal, you can create a Pattern Analysis rule with the help of regular expressions. This allows you to create fewer rules. For instance, if you know that various numbers appear in the tests, you could create several string rules for each number, or you could create a single RegEx rule to cover all numbers. Pattern analysis example:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"1gHxMAV2k9PNAXgQMByUwJ","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3cvlvLTtx5VkM1CD20LcW3","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Alternatively, if you know that some error logs end with the phrase \"not found,\" you can create a rule to identify such tests.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"twxq5w4D17ZG2HNC5vcKB","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7l1vpdGOfpfOvFVBrXGU6i","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"4. Create Most popular pattern table and disable unnecessary rules","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"If you have many rules, you can create ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/MostPopularPatternTableTop20"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“Most popular pattern table” widget","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" to view the Top-20 patterns that frequently appear in test automation results. The widget sorts patterns by how often they occur, allowing teams to easily spot common issues and plan how to fix them effectively.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"01cs6QPzEGFqGPg7KQeR9N","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"You can set some of Pattern Analysis rules as inactive if they are irrelevant for specific launches. You can also enable or disable Auto Pattern Analysis.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"20HZyt1nhdj9OfSM8HuC1C","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Don’t worry if you forget to enable Auto Pattern Analysis – you can always run Pattern Analysis manually.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"54JZoj8d1TJEEjxxPWRZKH","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"By setting up and customizing rules that match specific error patterns, teams can automate the identification and categorization of failures, leading to faster problem resolution and better overall software quality.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

title.title: Improving test failure analysis with pattern rules

leadParagraph.leadParagraph: ReportPortal has several features to support effective test failure analysis. This article provides actionable strategies for setting up Pattern Analysis rules to maximize the potential of this powerful analytical method and drive better business outcomes.

articleBody.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"As applications grow more complex, testing becomes increasingly important to ensure they meet quality standards. Central to the testing phase is the creation of test reports, which serve to inform stakeholders about test results, guide decision-making, and drive product improvements. In this article, we provide insights about effective test reports using ReportPortal.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is a test report?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"It is a well-organized summary of all testing activities with detailed information about the tests performed, execution results, identified defects, and other critical aspects.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"According to ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://glossary.istqb.org/en_US/home"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"ISTQB glossary","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":", there are two types of test report:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Test progress report (or test status report)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – this report provides an ongoing update on the status of testing activities and includes the status of test operations in comparison to a baseline.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Test completion report (or test summary report)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – this report is prepared at the conclusion of the testing phase and offers a comparison of the relevant test items with the exit criteria.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is the objective of test report?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The purpose of the test report is to provide a clear picture of how well the software meets the specified requirements and whether it is ready for release.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The test report helps to evaluate the overall health of the project and identify any critical defects.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"It also acts as a historical record of the testing procedure that may be consulted for similar problems in the future or for audits and projects.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Why do we need test reports?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This documentation is important for keeping everyone informed during the development process, especially in projects with multiple teams working together.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"By recording any risks found during testing, test reports ensure that everyone is aware of any problems that could affect the software's performance or usability before it is released. Test reports also allow teams to adjust their testing strategies as needed. This contributes to ongoing improvement in development practices and overall product quality.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is a good test report?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"A good test report is easy to read, with sections arranged so readers can quickly find the information they need.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"To create an effective test summary report, follow these steps:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. Describe the scope of testing.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Indicate which parts of the product were tested and specify any modules that were out of scope.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"FOTRHovFEHPABCZWTAg0C","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2. Document test environment details.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Include information about the hardware and software used, provide the application URL, and specify the database version.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"1aelmGUvPJGMqQGUAPxjyo","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3. Report on defect status.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Describe the total number of bugs, their status (open, closed, or in progress), and include its severity and priority to highlight critical issues.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5xJGFTfNJ3jKMAlZikyjLo","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6k3JRXfWz9gIQvtNWodg9R","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"4. Note insights.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Document the challenges encountered and suggest ideas for improvement.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"65QslQCbqgKUsWv2t1VYe6","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"5. Report on the status of exit criteria.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Compare the results with the agreed ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/blog/top-tips-for-using-quality-gates-in-reportportal"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"quality gates","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":", whether they passed or failed, and write the appropriate recommendations.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5ox1Xj7Lw2vwut17k5Be71","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Types of test automation reports","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In projects with automation, the automation test report can be included as part of the test summary report.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Our test reporting tool simplifies the creation of various types of test automation reports via widgets:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Summary report: ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"an overview of test execution: tests run, passed, and failed.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/OverallStatistics"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Overall Create ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/OverallStatistics"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Overall statistics","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" widget.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This widget provides a summary of key metrics from your test runs, such as the total number of tests, passed, failed, and skipped tests, offering a quick overview of the current state of test results.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4NOeGbrhTnoP88YshfFipU","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3. Create ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/LaunchesTable"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Launches table","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" widget.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This widget displays a detailed list of test launches, showing key information like launch names, execution times, status (passed/failed), and statistics on test cases within each launch.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6eM8lzQhtOkOYWlUij3bkO","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"4. Create ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/PassingRateSummary"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Passing rate summary","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" widget.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This widget provides a concise overview of the success rate of test executions, showing the percentage of passed tests out of the total executed tests.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6E0B18ig3NNjTH9eBVhymT","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Using ReportPortal can streamline the creation of test reports, making the testing process more organized and efficient. By observing best practices in test reporting, teams can effectively monitor progress, pinpoint issues, and refine their testing strategies over time, resulting in better-quality software products. Additionally, you can create custom reports with ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/ReportingAndMetricsInReportPortal#qa-and-test-automation-metrics-in-reportportal"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"test automation metrics","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" using ReportPortal's widgets, allowing for tailored insights for your specific needs.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

title.title: How to create test report with ReportPortal

leadParagraph.leadParagraph: As applications grow more complex, testing becomes increasingly important to ensure they meet quality standards. Central to the testing phase is the creation of test reports, which serve to inform stakeholders about test results, guide decision-making, and drive product improvements.

articleBody.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This is an article for people who runs tests using ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.cypress.io/"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Cypress","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" test framework and who wants to have better, deeper, prettier visibility on test results with ability to do AI-based defects triage and create test automation reports.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Cypress has its own dashboard, but there are a few benefits that are not available in Cypress Cloud and are present in ReportPortal: ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"free Open Source on-prem installation ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"unified reporting for different programming languages and frameworks (not only Cypress) ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"AI-based analysis of failed cases ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"advanced visualization ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Moreover, with ReportPortal, you can track the history of test results across different launches. By integrating Cypress with ReportPortal, you can overcome limitations.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In this article we will go through installation and configuration the ReportPortal's agent-js-cypress, running Cypress tests and update them with attributes, attachments, etc. With this agent, you can send test execution results to ReportPortal, creating a more robust, efficient, and insightful testing process.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Installing the Cypress Agent","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The first step involves installing the agent into the project. There is a small project with a few Cypress tests.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3rr2xpaZJDWyjGht4krcwc","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The tests are quite simple.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5y4vO6X8Zudozf2r5qe2pk","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The agent package is available on ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@reportportal/agent-js-cypress"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"NPM","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" and ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-cypress/pkgs/npm/agent-js-cypress"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"GitHub","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" registries.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Below, you can find the commands to install it using npm, yarn or pnpm.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7E4RLfcVB7StYO72fhi9na","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After installation, it will appear in the list of dependencies. At the time of writing this article, the latest version is 5.3.0.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After the installation, it is required to provide some ReportPortal configuration data.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Configuration of the Agent","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The next step involves configuring the agent and providing some basic options that will connect ReportPortal with the project.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"First, create a Cypress config file if you don't have one.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The basic configuration is presented below.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4YaVTbc4KIBy79RWw9KfOq","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The ‘dotenv/config’ used to get access to the ENVIRONMENT variables specified in ‘.env’ file. \nIt will be used to store the API key value.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"To obtain the configuration options, the ReportPortal profile page can be used.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. Open the ReportPortal instance (if you don’t have one the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://demo.reportportal.io/"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"demonstration instance","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" can be used) and log in. For a demo instance the GitHub login can be used.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4KKWGfhuxIRqjDKGOBDD2w","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2. Then navigate to the profile page. There, we can find a configuration example for Node.js.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"38re7bMdeudVs3E288ejNl","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"1Lr5YfxViNKTy9gepbCTsU","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3. Simply copy the JSON object and paste it into your project file assigning it to a variable, e.g. rpConfig’.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Let’s name the launch as e.g. ‘Custоm regressiоn with Cypress’ right after that.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"2cAzjp3rQh4QOSO95BInYZ","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"4. Provide an API key which can be generated on the API keys page in your profile.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Open the API Keys page and click on ‘Generate API Key’ button.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7mmsDvWrI9SaAZncEv60ft","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Specify the API Key name and click on ‘Generate’.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4hORmhuvQrcBTADhydSLev","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Detailed API Keys description can be found in the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/reportportal-configuration/HowToGetAnAccessTokenInReportPortal#2-authorization-with-users-api-key-for-agents"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"documentation.","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After generation the API Key can be copied to use it in the code.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Paste it as a value for ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"REPORTPORTAL_API_KEY ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"in ‘.env’ file and update ‘rpConfig’.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7HH60HckqaTLY09XDrlEnB","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"5. Instruct Cypress to use the agent as a reporter.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5FIPByjTcBfQOIdhmghx0n","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"blockquote","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"NOTE:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The full list of options with their description can be found in the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-cypress"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"agent’s repository","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Running Cypress Tests","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After completing the two steps above, run tests as usual.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. Run \"npm run test\" command.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"2H3xPiyo01JlB9nRlOAMlb","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2. Monitor the test's progress in ReportPortal. The state can be refreshed to obtain the latest results.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3MLPgBLPPrddI5NFqMriS3","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Let’s check the embedded reporter of Cypress. The statistics here match exactly.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3qqdmwpZKRSjkdBhIvpH12","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Update Cypress tests with additional data ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"You can enrich your Cypress test report by adding additional data. This includes description, attributes, logs, attachments, TestCaseID and status.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Description and attributes can be used to specify any extra information about the test and can also be used for filtering and building ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/WidgetCreation"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"some widgets","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":", like ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/ComponentHealthCheck/"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"\"Component Health Check\"","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":". Extra logs can also be provided together with attachments. The TestCaseID can be used as a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/work-with-reports/HistoryOfLaunches/"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"history ID","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" across different launches. There's also the option to change the status in ReportPortal for a particular test result.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"How to add additional data to the tests?","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"To use additional data within the tests, the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-cypress?tab=readme-ov-file#reportportal-custom-commands"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Cypress custom commands","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" can be used together with ReportPortal plugin.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Add the following code to your custom commands file (‘cypress/support/e2e.js’).","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3GUwYyK5Yruo1A0hfxp99s","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"And register ReportPortal plugin inside the configuration file via ’setupNodeEvents’ Cypress config parameter.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5viFn1Ytod2sfJdNZXyMbM","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. To provide ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-cypress?tab=readme-ov-file#report-attributes-for-tests"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"attributes","marks":[{"type":"underline"},{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"and a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-cypress?tab=readme-ov-file#report-description-for-tests"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"description","marks":[{"type":"underline"},{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":", use the custom commands within the tests.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6pfYouc3JNrUxCOJFCD3xt","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After running the tests again, the specified data will be visible in ReportPortal in the newly appeared launch. We just need to drill down into it to see the results.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"2OqNye6IVZe2rfTLWogFeJ","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3HcKwhQm4C84S3e2xeCmVr","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2. To insert ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"attachments","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-cypress?tab=readme-ov-file#logging"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"log custom commands","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" can be used with the file provided.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"2xGdDJlNeTxOCGBNiDDNMj","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After launch appearing in ReportPortal, the attachments can be found on the same place as logs.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4ZV38QGdy0m1Z5BdKzNN7Z","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Screenshots for failed tests generated by Cypress will be attached automatically.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"4. The ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"TestCaseID ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"is a unique test case identifier across all launches in ReportPortal. It is generated automatically based on code reference (physical location of the test within the project) and parameters (if exists). But the real test case ID from your test case management system can be used instead. To provide TestCaseID explicitly, call the \"setTestCaseId\" ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-cypress?tab=readme-ov-file#report-test-case-id-for-tests-and-suites"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"custom command","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"14fQOGDd0WAJNHKNVX0d1q","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Applied TestCaseID can be checked via ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Test item details","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" modal window.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5YCqnc6VugnwAxgUOegBIS","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"blockquote","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"NOTE:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Once the TestCaseID changed for the test result, it will be unlinked from its previous executions from historical data perspective.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"272TViQ0pZAzGZNccKdO1z","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"History of this test result within previous launches, where the TestCaseID was persistent between runs.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"IyJaMLsOIuhQ3CautIyew","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":" 5. title.title: Reporting Cypress test results to ReportPortal

leadParagraph.leadParagraph: This is an article for people who runs tests using Cypress test framework and who wants to have better, deeper, prettier visibility on test results with ability to do AI-based defects triage and create test automation reports.
